column4: Hi, I just noticed that the new Ubuntu Global Jam has been announced
but both jorge castro and jono bacon seem to have been quite silent about it
do you think that something's wrong with that?
I mean: I also googled for some acknowledgment of the announcement:
and it doesn't yield any result
not quite, but I still do clumsy mistakes :P
btw, there's only one month left
news to me, sounds good, but i'm having a cup of tea and a crack at getting this cam working in java, but bed as soon as tea is done
I don't know if you hang around it somewhat often... but I think there's a problem if you didn't know about it... because it's a symptom there's not enough communication about it
I think there are lots of people working on ubuntu, they probably all hanging out in ubuntu+1
and i'm helping out now, trying to get my cam wotking in java

well, get organised in your area if you know anyone. get involved yourself. most work on linux is done because someone wants a feature that is not implemented, then they start working on that feature.
i'd suggest you dont go bothering people to much
anyone reading this knows about the jam, now let us get on with what we are doing
good :) but until 5 minutes ago, it wasn't so... at least it seems we got some results :)

fine, but this is a support channel, you;ve used up a lot of typing, I'm happy you like ubuntu, but you dont have to worry that it's dieing , or that you can really huge support, we all do a little bit and it adds up
